item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, August 29, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Bypassing airport security via SQL injection (926 points | 225 comments)
2. Hawai'i-Issued Real IDs Can Be Added to Apple Wallet Beginning August 28 (34 points | 25 comments)
3. The secret inside One Million Checkboxes (38 points | 1 comment)
4. Elasticsearch is open source, again (174 points | 103 comments)
5. Launch HN: CodeViz (YC S24) – Visual maps of your codebase in VS Code (84 points | 25 comments)
6. Chrome is entrenching third-party cookies that will mislead users (225 points | 101 comments)
7. Ever used Google Chrome in incognito mode? You could be entitled to up to $5k (6 points | 4 comments)
8. Poly (YC S22) is hiring Rust experts in SF to build "Arc browser for files" ( | hide)
9. Raspberry Pi Pico does line rate 100M Ethernet (149 points | 22 comments)
10. Can solar costs keep shrinking? (177 points | 289 comments)
11. Dawn of a new era in Search: Balancing innovation, competition, and public good (164 points | 40 comments)
12. Show HN: A discovery-focused search engine for Hacker News (88 points | 19 comments)
13. Judge rules $400M algorithmic system illegally denied Medicaid benefits (232 points | 61 comments)
14. Launch HN: Patchwork (YC S24) – Automatically add structured logs to your code (66 points | 21 comments)
15. Smart mask for exhaled breath condensate harvesting and analysis (12 points | 1 comment)
16. Judges rule Big Tech's free ride on Section 230 is over (258 points | 298 comments)
17. OpenAI is good at unminifying code (789 points | 271 comments)
18. Show HN: An open-source, local-first Webflow for your own app (145 points | 43 comments)
19. How I learned to stop worrying and love userspace networking (125 points | 27 comments)
20. Show HN: Homemade automated solar concentrator (241 points | 63 comments)
21. Floating points between zero and one (63 points | 46 comments)
22. Rescuing songs that record labels forgot existed (145 points | 20 comments)
23. OpenVMS x86_64 at the Edge (11 points | 4 comments)
24. Web Design Museum (141 points | 31 comments)
25. Air Con: $1697 for an on/off switch (1713 points | 442 comments)
26. Frank Lloyd Wright's Only Skyscraper Is Heading to Auction (5 points | discuss)
27. GNU Screen 5.0 Released (193 points | 95 comments)
28. How Intel Missed the iPhone: The XScale Era (87 points | 82 comments)
29. What Life Means to Einstein (1929) [pdf] (99 points | 49 comments)
30. Memos: stick private notes on your email (68 points | 49 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Thursday, August 29, 2024 at 10:15 PM UTC
